intro: Acosta sivasica, commonly known as the Sivasica acosta, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Turkey. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a smooth texture and are arranged alternately along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Acosta sivasica is considered a vulnerable species.
